actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means, H. Rept. 94-209.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Finance, S. Rept. 94-176.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: An Act to amend section 1113 of the Social Security Act to make permanent the program of temporary assistance for United States citizens returned from abroad, subject to specific limitations on the aggregate dollar amount of such assistance which may be provided and on the period for which such assistance may be furnished in any particular case, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Limits the total amount of temporary assistance provided under the Social Security Act to United States citizens returning from abroad to $8,000,000 during the fiscal years 1975 and 1976 and $300,000 during any succeeding fiscal year. Revises the term "temporary assistance" to mean assistance not exceeding ninety days, except that such assistance may be furnished beyond ninety days upon a finding by the Secretary that such assistance is justified. Extends through June 30, 1976, the eligibility of Supplemental Security Income recipients under the Social Security Act to recieve food stamps.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 1113 of the Social Security Act to make permanent the program of temporary assistance for U.S. citizens returned from abroad, subject to specific limitations on the aggregate dollar amount of such assistance which may be provided and on the period for which such assistance may be furnished in any particular case.

An Act to amend section 1113 of the Social Security Act to make permanent the program of temporary assistance for United States citizens returned from abroad, subject to specific limitations on the aggregate dollar amount of such assistance which may be provided and on the period for which such assistance may be furnished in any particular case, and for other purposes.
